dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Promise you won’t laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM A DISTANCE AWAY: Cole and Slide bestride the sidewal Cole doing the talking, Slide the listening. Then, about halfway down the block, Slide stops in his tracks and sta at Cole. We can’t hear what he says but we can imagine. C smiles and insists: no, he’s not fucking with him. A BLOCK AWAY AND WE’RE HIGH ABOVE THE STREET NOW as Cole Slide round a corner. Cole points up and Slide looks.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: specifically the penthouse. Slide looks upon it the way s men look upon Everest, with ambition and abject terror. And thus begins a RECRUITMENT MONTAGE -- EXT. MCCARREN PARK --— BROOKLYN -- DAY -- BEGINNING WITH DEV’REAUX, who is walking along, sudden aware of a PRESENCE walking behind him. Flicking a glance backwards, he sees a GUY with A BASEBALL BAT. Heart pounding, he picks up speed, afraid to break out into a d run, but veering off the path to the left. The guy keeps walking. Then approaches HIS 10 YEAR OLD KI tousles his hair and hands him the bat, pulling out a SOFTBALL. Just a Dad and son, playing ball. Dev exhales. Then stiffens, sensing more presences. Turns to find COLE and SLIDE standing behind him.  59.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Don’t you get tired of jumping out of your skin like that? DEV’ REAUX What you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: How much do you owe those guys? And don’t say “what guys,” I know when you've been sleeping, I know when you're awake.”

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: (sighs) Okay. I made a few... optimistic predictions.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: --Dumb-ass bets-- Dev’reaux really doesn’t get it. Stares at Cole. DEV’ REAUX How come you not firing me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE WHEELS OF A BABY STROLLER rolling along... pushed Fitzhugh, spending an afternoon comparing pathetically ul low prices on hideous canned meat. Cole falls in alongsid him.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Fitz. What if there was a way in this lifetime to permanently avoid Spam?

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: (defensive) You know, there are some people who actually like Spam.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You’re not one of them. EXT. COLE’S BUILDING -- NIGHT Cole loads a misty-eyed Lester into a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Mr. Howard, I don’t know how to...  60.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Sh-sh. No need, Lester.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: (as they shake) Thank you... Cole. Lester gets in; the cab goes. Cole looks up. Sprinkled around the block, waiting, are Charlie, Slide, Dev’reaux Fitzhugh. Cole gives the signal: coast’s clear, c’mon in. INT. COLE’S APARTMENT -- NIGHT Our five guys sit around a fold-out card table. Cole has just laid out, with Slide’s help, “the plan.” The others stunned into silence by the audacity of it. After a spell Charlie leans forward and speaks. Very, very slowly.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Good, good thinking. Let’s just rob the penthouse apartment of the building we work in -- with the tenant still inside -- with FBI agents STATIONED OUTSIDE THE FRONT DOOR, WITH security cameras -- to steal twenty million that MIGHT be in there -- IN THE MIDDLE OF OUR

dialogues.speaker: SHIFT
dialogues.text: There’s no mistaking Charlie’s tone for enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: It’s a little frisky, I admit.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Why don’t I just pull out a bomb on an airplane? Same odds of getting away!

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What do you think, Fitz?

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Can you come back to me?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You said it: if you’re gonna steal, steal big.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Listen, I am beyond comfortable with white collar crime... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: no matter how much you steal, if you do it with decimal points instead of a crowbar...? Worst case, you’re out in two.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: How far out you got our asses hanging on this thing?

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Your jobs are compartmentalized. In fact, technically you wouldn't be doing anything illegal.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (he doesn’t want to skirt the truth) Well -- aiding and abetting.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (exasperated, to Cole) You’ve lost your mind.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Look. Braniff’s gonna walk away clean on this thing with 20 million dollars unless we do something. The five of us. You see? We’re the cavalry.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, cavalry! A concierge, a building manager, an elevator operator... and this one -- this guy I don’t know from Adam -- your childhood buddy who YOU trust because he’s been stealing since you were in your playpen--? It’s a moment of truth between Charlie and Cole. They hol each other’s stares.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Charlie... You know why I’m doing this, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, ‘cause of Lester. The man is 74 years old, you're gonna throw your life away for a --

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Cause if we don’t do this, we’re all gonna be Lester!  62.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: (suddenly) I’m in!

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: ... Work hard for fifty years, play by the rules, then wind up with nothing! A beat. We sense Charlie almost wavering. But...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I got a family.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Then take care of them. ‘Cause no one else will. Another beat. Cole pulls out all the stops.

dialogues.speaker: COLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, Charlie. It’s the first time he’s ever called Charlie by his first name, and we see it hit, in Charlie’s eyes. But then.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Low, low blow my friend. He starts to leave the room, turns at the door.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any other time? That would've meant a lot. He goes. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: You want me to kill him?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Would you stop?! He’s not going to tell anybody. But Cole is nervous. Fitzhugh speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: When I am faced with a decision I generally make lists of pros and cons...? (waves the paper he’s been writing on) And it seems that... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I would rather do hard time as someone’s bitch than see my family living in a car. Slide turns to Cole and smiles -- they have their crew! EXT. COLE’S BUILDING -- ROOF -- DAY A cold day in February. There will be no TRAINING MONTAGE cause there’s nothing to train for. There’s only this: ou four guys -- Cole, Slide, Dev and Fitzhugh -- bundled up overcoats, freezing their asses off on Cole’s frozen roof

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: OK, day of the heist, we’ve got to be prepared for different potentialities. (as Fitzhugh opens his mouth) No, that’s not a word. Don’t care. (Dev raises his hand) Yeah, Dev?

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: Why are we outside? My balls are sno-cones.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah, can’t we go in? I can’t think.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Exactly why we’re up here. We don’t know how cold that day’s going to be, could be raining, could be hailing frogs. We've gotta be able to think on our feet. Okay so let’s say it turns out to be diamonds in Braniff’s safe. No problem, we put ‘em in our pocket. But what if it’s a stack of cash the size of... Cole points to an old rotting refrigerator box on the roo

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: We could throw it down the garbage chute, pick it up downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Okay, but how do we control the trash room?  64.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: (to Slide) You’re the professional, you tell us. Slide looks from man to man to man, amused: this is who h working with. Then, he crosses to the refrigerator box --

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Here’s what we do. -- plucks it up, tears it in two and crams it in an empty trash can. He sets his Zippo to it. Dev and Fitz gather around to warm their hands.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We lucky enough to get in and outta that penthouse with his shit, gettin’ it out of the building's the fun part! The men stare at him. What?! Fun? Slide turns to Cole.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Cole) When you thinking we do this? Cole joins the fire, his confidence shaken just a tad.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: A day where people are very, very distracted. BAGPIPES and DRUMS transport us weeks ahead, to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- THE SAINT PATRICK’S DAY PARADE. Running straight up 5t Avenue. The sidewalks teem with onlookers. It’s March 16th. The day of the heist. REVELERS -- beefy, Irish looking blowhards, are tussling the street. Three of them pick up a fourth and stuff him a garbage can, all of them howling with laughter. Looming high above the parade -- lest we forget how very, very tall it is -- is The Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester is back on the job. He monitors the crazed crowds through the front window as Fitzhugh comes up beside him.  65.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Who is St. Patrick, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: The Patron Saint of cirrhosis. (a hand on his shoulder) Good to have you back, Lester. INT. THE TOWER -- COLE’S OFFICE -- DAY - TIGHT ON Cole’s fingers drumming on his desk. He’s nervous. MISS HOLLINGSWORTH stands before him, bitching, her 100 YEAR O MOTHER, OLD MRS. HOLLINGSWORTH in a wheelchair beside her catatonic. (We saw Miss H. before, bitching to Cole in th early montage.)

dialogues.speaker: MISS HOLLINGSWORTH
dialogues.text: .--but Mother has to get her pills at EXACTLY NOON. And if you’ve given Rosie the day off! Who’s going to--

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Rosie’s had an emergency. I've arranged a substitute.

dialogues.speaker: MISS HOLLINGSWORTH
dialogues.text: (grudgingly accepting) Hmpf . INT. THE TOWER -- FITZHUGH’S APARTMENT -- DAY Kids scream and frolic, herded into coats by Mrs. Fitzhug In the bedroom, Fitzhugh tries to steel his courage.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. FITZHUGH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Honey! We’re going! Fitzhugh steps out. Hugs each kid deeply -- will he be behind bars next time he sees them? -- kisses his wife.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: (off his intensity) Yeesh. We're going away one night, what’s up with you? She searches his face.  66.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Nothing!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: I’d think it was another woman but you can’t even take her to MacDonald's. They laugh grimly. He hugs her tight.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: Does Grandma have ice cream?

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: (mortified) Yes. Because Grandma has a freezer. Fitzhugh watches them to the elevator and Mrs. Fitzhugh b him a kiss before she disappears. Fitz catches it, scared

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie organizes the front desk. As far as he knows, it’ just another day. Until he eyes Cole and Dev exit the bac halls together and his antennae go up. Maybe it’s the conspiratorial way Cole sends Dev off on an errand. As Cole passes by, they trade nods: in the weeks since Charlie bowed out, a chilly distance has grown between th INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- DAY Susan Braniff dresses in her massive walk-in closet with floor-to-ceiling shoe shelves as her husband sits atop th bed talking on his cell.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR BRANIFF
dialogues.text: -- no, Marty, I won’t, I don’t care, that’s too long. Go back, no, listen to me, go back and offer five months and tell ‘em I’1l give up Myerson, Witt and Golding -- (aside, to Susan) -- could you ask Cunningham or whoever’s on sentry today to get lunch? I’m starved --

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BRANIFF
dialogues.text: (weary of her stay-at-home husband's demands) -- yes, I'll ask Cunningham or whomever’s on sentry --  67.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR BRANIFF
dialogues.text: -- and ask him to go ahead and order, will ya? I’m gonna be on with Marty a while longer -- (back on the phone) -- whatya mean they don’t care about Golding, he was up to his tits in this -- WE GO WITH SUSAN through the apartment as she plucks up h purse. She hesitates at an envelope with two theater tick peeking out, takes them too. She exits into the elevator anteroom where young AGENT CUNNINGHAM keeps sentry.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BRANIFF
dialogues.text: Ah, so it’s you today, Agent--

dialogues.speaker: AGENT CUNNINGHAM
dialogues.text: (hates this gig, hates her) Cunningham. I’ve only told you a dozen times, ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BRANIFF
dialogues.text: You people all blur in my mind. My husband wants his lunch now. She presses the elevator call-button and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- ‘PH’ lights up on a panel. Washington reports in his m

dialogues.speaker: WASHINGTON
dialogues.text: Headed up to the penthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole hears this on his walkie/takes out his cell/dials. INT. MISS HOLLINGSWORTH’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS The stringy, Miss Hollingsworth gestures contemptuously a OLD MRS. HOLLINGSWORTH in a wheelchair -- Brooke Astor incarnate. In front of the aged lady is a tray with Jell- and on the tray, SEVERAL PILLS.

dialogues.speaker: MISS HOLLINGSWORTH
dialogues.text: Now, she gets very agitated -- I need you to help me hold her while you give her the pills.  68. The CAMERA turns around. And we see that the ATTENDANT helping her... is DEV’REAUX.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: Yes, yes... they explained it all to me, ma’am. At your service. As they approach the old lady, she moans and shrinks in terror. Dev can’t help but notice: DEV’REAUX (CONT’D) She really don’t like ‘em, does she?

dialogues.speaker: MISS HOLLINGSWORTH
dialogues.text: It’s total dementia. She doesn’t know what’s best for her.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: Yes, ma’am. As Miss Hollingsworth holds her mother, Dev’reaux RAISES PILLS to the woman’s lips... ...then PALMS THEM. Is that a flicker of appreciation in the old woman’s eyes We’re not sure. INT. THE TOWER -- FITZHUGH’S APARTMENT -- CONTINUOUS The place is nearly empty now. A sofa, a cabinet, little else left. Fitz sits, eyes closed, when RIINNG.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Howard? COLE’S VOICE Mr. Fitzhugh, you’re up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Washington and Mrs. Braniff ride in silence. DING! Fitzhu steps aboard. Smiles are exchanged.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Hello. Sorry, we met around Christmas. I’m Chase Fitzhugh.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BRANIFF
dialogues.text: (an unpleasant memory) I remember.  69. The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: (making conversation) off to lunch?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BRANIFF
dialogues.text: My friends tell me it’s unwise to be seen eating out these days. They mean it’s unwise for them to be seen eating out with me these days. Fitzhugh feigns empathy.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: How awful! You did nothing wrong. (spots the theater tix) Ah, you have tickets for a matinee. What show?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BRANIFF
dialogues.text: These? Someone dropped them off yesterday, someone I obviously don’t know, because I despise Shakespeare.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: (through clenched teeth) Just a mass of cliches, isn’t he? Nodding in agreement, she RIPS THE TICKETS IN HALF, tosse them. Fitzhugh sighs. Strike one. DING! They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole withdraws a cake from a hiding place. Sets it alongs a cake knife, plastic forks, paper plates, etc.. Licks frosting off his hand --

dialogues.speaker: MS. DOLOWITZ
dialogues.text: Mr. Howard, you wanted to see me?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Yes, Ms. Dolowitz. Would you assemble the maid staff in the package room please?

dialogues.speaker: MS. DOLOWITZ
dialogues.text: (nervous ) Now?  70.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: No job cuts. Don’t worry. (she moves to use her mic) Radio silence if you would. Ms. Dolowitz thinks it odd but obeys. As she goes, Dev arrives in the doorway. He nods: mission accomplished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie tracks Mrs. B and Fitz out the elevator door and across the lobby as Cole appears.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Mr. Gibbs, Mr. Svichkar, may I see you both in the package room?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (on guard, resistant) Who’1l watch the desk?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Mr. Dev’reaux can.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (fuck) Certainly. Dev comes around to man the front desk. Svichkar heads in the package room and Charlie follows him, reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan Braniff exits the Tower, followed by Fitzhugh.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Thanks, Lester. (to Mrs. B) Beautiful day. You know what I love to do on days like today? Take the ferry to Staten Island. Out on the water, feel the breeze, drink a little chablis...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BRANIFF
dialogues.text: (a brushback) Then I think you should go do that. Good afternoon, Mr. Fetzer. She goes. Foiled, Fitz gives her a moment, then tails her  71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie joins Washington, Dolowitz, the maids and other s here. Cole signals them to enter quietly.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Cole, what are you --

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Sh-sh-sh. (then, in a stern voice) Ms. Perez, a word with you. Perez’s had her nose in the mail until now; she looks up, surprised to find so many people in her workspace. COLE (CONT’D) Ms. Perez, your job here is to monitor the delivery of incoming and outgoing mail. And yet the most important letter this building may receive all year slipped your attention. (withdraws an envelope) From the “American Bar Association?” She swallows hard as he hands over the letter. Everyone i the room looks hopeful for her. She opens it, starts to read...and her eyes well up.

dialogues.speaker: PEREZ
dialogues.text: I passed! (everybody cheers) How did you know?! I might’ve flunked!

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I know exactly how much time you had to study. Congrats, counselor. Cole reveals the cake from the kitchen. As Perez cuts the first slice, Cole glances at Charlie, who feels foolish f being so paranoid. However --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- at the front desk, Dev has seized the moment to disman the front desk switchboard and detach Braniff’s phone lin

dialogues.speaker: COLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Dev’reaux, piece of cake?  72.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: You betcha. As Dev’reaux reaches for his slice his hand brushes again Cole’s, and COLE PALMS SOMETHING out of Dev’s hand. One guess what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Braniff navigates a path through the St. Patty’s Day revelers. Not far behind Fitzhugh keeps an inconspicuous tail. She diverts onto a side street and he mirrors her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DELIVERY GUY from the neighborhood deli enters. He salu Charlie, back at his post --

dialogues.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
dialogues.text: Lunch for Rapunzel. -- and Charlie waves him on through. Just then Cole emerg with two slices of cake in hand.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Just a sec. Do me a favor and take these up to Mr. and Mrs. Braniff? We’re all pretty torn up that they’re unjustly imprisoned this way and can’t be part of our celebration, and they do love German chocolate cake... (the Delivery Guy glares at him: you kidding?) I know, “do it yourself,” but see, the FBI draws guns when there's extra people up there... Here, let me take these and you take these... And before the Delivery Guy can protest, Cole’s taken his delivery pouch from him and loaded him with two plates of cake, forks, napkins, etc. Charlie knows something is up.

dialogues.speaker: COLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got ‘em? Great. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Next time wait on the prick yourself.  73. Charlie’s antennae are up again. He turns to see: the ent Tower staff is eating cake. Uh-oh. He sets down his slice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SQUADRON OF MOUNTED COPS pass by, on parade. INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- CONTINUOUS Braniff watches the parade from his window, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR BRANIFF
dialogues.text: No -- wait -- no -- THURSDAY? I want to be out of here MONDAY -- I’ve got a villa reserved in Como-- OK, OK, yeah. If you can get that, close it. Let’s make the deal and be done with it. (he hangs up; there’s a KNOCK at the door) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT CUNNINGHAM
dialogues.text: (sticks his head in) Lunch is here.

dialogues.speaker: ON A PAIR OF FLORSHEIM WINGTIPS CLICKING ALONG THE SIDEWA
dialogues.text: They belong to a man in a Brooks Brothers suit, bespectac carrying a briefcase. He approaches the Tower.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: May I help you, sir?

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: (a mid-Atlantic accent) Yes, I’m here to see an apartment. INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- DAY The Delivery Guy places sandwiches on Braniff’s dining ta And the TWO SLICES OF CAKE.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR BRANIFF
dialogues.text: (re: the cake) What’s this shit?

dialogues.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
dialogues.text: They gamme it downstairs, some guy. Braniff eyes the cake, uneasy.  74.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR BRANIFF
dialogues.text: (suspicious) Not the manager?

dialogues.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR BRANIFF
dialogues.text: Was he supercilious?

dialogues.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
dialogues.text: --Expi-alidocious! The delivery guy gives him a fuck-you grin. Braniff scowl pays the guy. And pointedly gives him a ONE CENT tip. Whe the delivery guy and Cunningham are gone, Braniff takes h food straight to the kitchen -- -- and dumps the cake in the trash. He’s not taking any chances if it was sent up by Cole. Then: he unwraps his corned beef sandwich and takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole bites into an identical corned beef sandwich. Charli appears in his doorway.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Dijon?! How ivory tower, Dijon on corned beef...!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: If that was Braniff’s, you sure they all obeyed your order about not spitting in it?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: They always obey my... He thinks. Hm. He drops the sandwich in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Stop this. Now. So far the worst you've done is, what, drug the man?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: That is a horrible accusation. He ain’t sayin’ a thing.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: He can still just wake up, never know what happened. If you keep going with this...  75.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What, Charlie? You'll call the cops on me? After all the years we've worked side by side?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Don’t make me choose. We see, on his desk, PICTURES of Charlie with a WIFE and KIDS. Also children’s DRAWINGS -- Fathers Day Cards. Cole sees what Charlie has to lose. He nods. Over both their walkies: SVICHKAR’S VOICE Mr. Howard, I have a Mr. Bissell here to see you. Cole starts out. Charlie shoots him a look -- don’t! Cole measures him, goes anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korean manicurists start in on Mrs. Braniff’s hands and f she lies back, towel over her eyes, indulged to the max. Fitzhugh monitors from across the street, checks his watc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slide, in costume, speaks to Svichkar at the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: -- I spoke to Mr. Fitzhugh himself and he assured me it was fine.

dialogues.speaker: SVICHKAR
dialogues.text: We still have to follow protocol. (Cole arrives) Mr. Howard, this is Mr. Bissell. He was hoping to view the Fitzhugh property but they’re not at home.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Not a problem. I'’11 show you up. Emerging behind Cole, Charlie takes one look at Slide in pinstripe suit and can’t contain himself.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon, you gotta be, you can’t expect anyone’ll believe this...  76.

dialogues.speaker: SVICHKAR
dialogues.text: Mr. Howard, we don’t have clearance from the Fitzhughs.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: That’s okay, Mr. Svichkar. Come, Mr. Bissell, elevators’re this way. Charlie spots Mr. Simon entering the lobby and recognizes chance to safely sabotage Cole’s heist.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (too loudly) Are you forgetting that we need written consent from an owner before admitting any visitor into their unit? (Cole keeps moving) Isn’t that right, Mr. Simon?!

dialogues.speaker: MR. SIMON
dialogues.text: (finally paying notice) Is there a problem, Mr. Howard? Cole stops, shoots Charlie a look: well played. Then:

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I have the situation under control, Mr. Simon.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SIMON
dialogues.text: What situation?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: This gentleman is here to see the Fitzhugh apartment. Unfortunately we have no written consent from them.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SIMON
dialogues.text: Then there’s no issue. He can’t go up. Advantage: Charlie. Cole’s stymied. He’s rescued by --

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Perhaps I can shed some light, Mister...?

dialogues.speaker: MR. SIMON
dialogues.text: Simon, Tower property manager.  77.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Morris Bissell, Liberty Mutual. My bank handles the Fitzhugh mortgage.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SIMON
dialogues.text: Don’t you mean “handled?” He snickers at his own (unfunny) joke. Slide draws Mr. Si aside, for discretion’s sake. Meanwhile, Mr. Lindus approaches/distracts Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: LINDUS
dialogues.text: ...why are all these people outside?...

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Recently we were forced to foreclose on the Fitzhughs, sadly. We allowed them a thirty-day grace period to move but technically the bank is now tenant of record so...

dialogues.speaker: MR. SIMON
dialogues.text: Sorry, your name again was...?

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Morris Bissell. He withdraws a business card, hands it to Simon. It reads “Morris Bissell, Liberty Mutual.” Simon turns to Cole:

dialogues.speaker: MR. SIMON
dialogues.text: Take him on up. Sorry for the confusion, Mr. Bissell. Now it’s Charlie who’s stymied. As Cole and Slide continu to the elevators, under their breaths:

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Where’d you get the business card?

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Some dude’s wallet I... found. Your buddy gonna be cool? Cole shoots Charlie a look as he boards the elevator and Slide sets a finger to his lips just as its doors close. Charlie, incensed, grabs the phone at the front desk. He starts to dial, then hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: SVICHKAR
dialogues.text: Who you calling?  78.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. (he slams the phone down; Cole was right; he can’t turn them in) Shit! MUSIC PUMPS UP as the heist kicks into higher gear and --

dialogues.speaker: THREE-SIXTY VIEW OF THE CITY SURROUNDING THEM.
dialogues.text: Dev’reaux is already here, supplies in hand. He tosses ea man a white jumpsuit and gloves, then proceeds to remove tarp from a WINDOW-WASHING PLATFORM stored at the roof ed MOMENTS LATER, Cole and Slide, wearing their jumpsuits ov their suits, help Dev hoist the platform over the side of building and into position. Slide peers over the side: it’s a heart-stopping, vertigi view. Cole appears beside him.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: You ever done this before?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I get dizzy stepping off the curb. (cell buzzes; he picks up) Mr. Fitzhugh, how are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzhugh continues to watch Susan Braniff’s nails get don

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: They’ve finished moisturizing her feet and’re about to start buffing.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Do you have a plan?

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: I’m... pondering. From a newsstand he plucks up a magazine promoting an art “Inside The Braniff Swindle.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole hangs up, dials a new number. Meanwhile, Slide tests the platform cables’ strength. To Dev:  79.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: How much weight can this baby bear? Dev has only his elevator operator experience to guide hi

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: I push the buttons! Do I look like a structural engineer! INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- DAY Braniff’s cell RINGS on his dining table. Braniff is nowh to be seen. Is he asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: No answer. Whatya think?

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: We got two hours. Tops. As good a final thought as any. Over the side they go. A WIDE VIEW of the Tower, Central Park beyond it, the par on the street below and on top our two faux window-washer climbing out onto a two-foot wide, ten-foot long apparatu Dev hands Slide his banker’s briefcase as he gives Cole a quick tutorial.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: This is your ‘up’ button, this is your ‘down.’ This locks it in place. Run into any trouble, this might be manual override I got up here. Might not.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: You got my back. Nice to know. Cole lowers them from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzhugh enters, approaches the young female PROPRIETOR a the front, careful not to be seen by Mrs. Braniff within.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Hi... Speak English? (she indicates a little; he opens his magazine) Know who this is? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (he points out Braniff; (she nods/scowls) Good. This is his wife. He points from a picture of Mrs. Braniff to the real deal currently being waited on by a trio of manicurists. The Proprietor doesn’t like this one bit.

dialogues.speaker: PROPRIETOR
dialogues.text: (her English is better than she let on) That bitch is in my shop? Fitz takes out a pair of $100’s.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Need you to do me a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABOARD THE PLATFORM WITH COLE AND SLIDE, more than anythi else it’s claustrophobic up here: there’s no place to go, barely any place to step. Both Cole and Slide can’t help looking at the drop as they descend.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Aren’t we not supposed to look down?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I remember that now. --My God!! (re: a streaked window pane) I’ve been paying these window washers, and THIS is the service they-- these people are criminals!!

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: You the criminal!!

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (nonplussed) No! I’m...

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: You just “frisky.” FROM WITHIN THE PENTHOUSE: The window-washer apparatus lo into view. Still no sign of Braniff inside. Cole stops their descent when they’re flush with the apartment. OUTSIDE: Slide opens up his briefcase. Inside is the very latest in fiberglass-cutting technology: a suction-clamp an extendable arm attached to a blade.  81. Slide affixes it to the window and prepares to cut. He lo to Cole, who dials Braniff’s cell again. INSIDE: Braniff’s cell RINGS. Unanswered. OUTSIDE: Cole nods to Slide: do it. Slide begins to cut. INSIDE: While it’s not exactly noisy, the bladework’s lou enough to draw attention from anyone inside the apartment ON THE ROOF, Dev watches from above. Over his walkie: WASHINGTON’S VOICE Mr. Dev’reaux, what’s your twenty? DEV’ REAUX I’m, um, in the building -- why? WASHINGTON’S VOICE Mr. Svichkar’s taking his break, need you to come cover for him.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: Why, certainly. On my way. He mouths: FU-UCK! He doesn’t move. A FLOOR BELOW: Slide finishes slicing a four-foot circle of the window. Then, with a practiced push, he thrusts th entire piece of fiberglass into the penthouse without dropping it, then lays it softly on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Now this I’ve done. A pro at this, Slide lifts one leg out of the apparatus, straddling its rail, then dips his foot inside the four-f hole. When his foot’s flat on the floor, he pulls himself over and inside the apartment, ducking his head as he goe Now it’s Cole’s turn. Not a pro. He tries to mimic Slide’ method but once he’s got a foot inside the penthouse -- -- a sharp wind picks up and banks off the edifice, pushi the apparatus out. Just as Cole begins to flounder, Slide reaches out and grabs him and pulls him in. They’ve breached the penthouse. INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- CONTINUOUS The two men stand absolutely still, panting, listening. T to verify if Braniff’s actually asleep.  82. First things first, though. Cole tip-toes to the front do leading to the elevator anteroom and -- ever so slowly -- bolts it. ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DOOR: Agent Cunningham, wrapped in a magazine, doesn’t hear a thing. BACK IN THE PENTHOUSE: Cole signals Slide: you check that way, I'll go this way. Slide, who’s never stepped foot inside such a decadent living space (much less b&e’d one) takes it all in. He pretends to be blase:

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: North facing windows. You call that natural light? For 50 million, you should get two exposures at least!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done with her pedicure, Mrs. Braniff rises from her chair She rudely waves off the help of those who’ve labored ove her the past hour, then:

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BRANIFF
dialogues.text: Where are my shoes? The manicurists look around too. No one knows. The Proprietor looks on, hiding a smile. SUSAN BRANIFF (CONT’D) Excuse me. My shoes?! You DO know those were Louboutin’s!!!! Where. Are. My. Shoes?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strolling along, Fitz tosses Mrs. B’s shoes onto a roof. takes out his cell and dials.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Hello, New York Post? Do you have a paparazzi desk? -- I mean, do fish swim, but-- INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- DAY Cole corrals the shitsus into Mrs. Braniff’s shoe-filled in and shuts the door. Slide, meanwhile, conducts a searc for Braniff. He ducks his head into a DEN, sees nothing, starts to go when SNORING draws him back.  83. Braniff has fallen off a couch and lies asleep on the flo sandwich wrapper at his side.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: This the mofo? Cole appears to confirm it is. MOMENTS LATER, PULLING BACK FROM THE WALL as Cole and Sli move furniture and lamps away from it. Slide starts tapping along its surface, strikes something unforgiving and follows its perimeter. Then, withdrawing chisel, he prepares to drive it into the surface but -- -- Cole stops him first. Concerned the noise might alert Sentry outside. He looks about, finds a universal remote coffee table and punches in a selection. The voice of Barry Manilow suddenly fills the penthouse. “,..oh Mandy, well you came and you gave without taking.. Slide scowls at him. Cole gestures: not my playlist. Slid resumes his work, burying the chisel into the drywall. IN THE ANTEROOM: Agent Cunningham shakes his head at Braniff’s choice in music, flips the page on his magazine “,..but I sent you away, oh Mandy...”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Braniff is apoplectic, ranting.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BRANIFF
dialogues.text: How. Can you possibly. Have lost. One of the ONLY NINE PAIRS of Day Lewises produced in Florence, Italy in THE LAST CENTURY?! Besides the fact that they should be in the MET, how’m I supposed to walk home? No one looks sympathetic...

dialogues.speaker: PROPRIETOR
dialogues.text: So sorry, please you take coupon for free visit? Susan Braniff, apoplectic, storms out the door, only to b met by --  84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a WALL OF PAPARAZZI, flashing/clicking away at Public Enemy #1’s wife in bare feet. Mrs. Braniff is mortified. She tries to cover her face, trudging forward, tip-toeing through midtown trash, barraged at every angle by blindin flashbulbs. It’s almost possible to feel sorry for her. Then, hero to the rescue, Fitzhugh steps forth.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Mrs. Braniff, you alright?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BRANIFF
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s you... Fisticuffs...

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Whatever. Here, let me help. (to the paparazzi) Please, gentlemen, have some dignity. He guides her to the street, still swarmed by photographe then into the back seat of a cab.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BRANIFF
dialogues.text: Thank you so much, Mister, uh... I keep losing it. (to the cabbie) The Tower, please --

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: No, no, no. They’re there, too. Swarming.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BRANIFF
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Do you have a relative nearby? Someone you can stay with until I can douse these prurient flames?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BRANIFF
dialogues.text: A sister in Greenwich.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Go there. I’1l have the building call you when it’s safe. The taxi whisks Mrs. Braniff away, paparazzi clicking. Fitzhugh watches it go, then turns to them.  85.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: 501 Cherry Street, Greenwich. Go to town. INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- DAY Slide purchases a grip on the drywall he’s dug into. Then moment of truth, he yanks it. Cole looks, sighs with reli A large titanium safe sits within. Our guys share a smile and Slide begins to inspect it.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (whispered) Can we get it out?

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Cemented in. Hand me the case. Cole grabs the case and Slide removes the tools of his tr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzhugh returns to the Tower. He looks up to the platfor high above. Boy is he glad that’s not his part of the hei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitz heads straight for the elevators. Mr. Simon approach

dialogues.speaker: MR. SIMON
dialogues.text: Mr. Fitzhugh...

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Mr. Simon?

dialogues.speaker: MR. SIMON
dialogues.text: Mr. Bissell from Liberty Mutual went up to your apartment a few minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: (no idea who that is) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SIMON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to hear of your financial difficulties. If there’s anything we can do to assist you --

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: -- oh, no, no thanks --  86.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SIMON
dialogues.text: -- for instance, arrange a moving company for the weekend? That stops him. Mr. Simon’s giving him an eviction notice Fitz’d like to slap the needlehead’s face.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Thanks. The solution is definitely underway. He goes. Meanwhile, Charlie gets an idea, picks up the phone, presses ‘PH.’ Listens. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with the phones? INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- CONTINUOUS “,..feel sad when you're sad, feel glad when you're glad. As Slide toils, Cole casts a glance to where Braniff snoo

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Time table?

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Six hours. Five minutes. Somewhere between the two. Wanna wake him up and ask him the combination? (re: the music and Braniff) ‘f you keep this shit on, I fall more asleep than him. Cole finds the remote, kills the Manilow. He checks his watch, edgy, unsure what to do with himself. He peers out the hole in the window to see the parade below when HIS C PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t answer!

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I’m supposed to be working! I’d answer! (clicks phone on) Hello? And we CROSS CUT BETWEEN:  87. INT. JILLIAN’S APARTMENT - NIGHT It looks a lot like Cole’s. The home of a single person who’s never home, sparsely furnished. She’s even eating K Pao chicken out of a container, just like Cole did earlie

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Hi, ah... this is...

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Jillian?

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. Good guess.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What’s up? It is very disconcerting for him to be talking to an FBI agent while watching his buddy crack a safe.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: This is a personal-slash- professional call.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh. I -- that’s nice. I hope.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Well, yes. I hope too. An awkward pause. And she’s not usually awkward.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I, ah, just wanted to mention that there was, in our last meeting, a path you were considering going down... and I just wanted to warn you that if you were to go down that path... none of which did I suspect for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Damn! He’s fumbled a combination. He tries again.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: What--

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Lobby commotion. Go on, go on...  88.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Um. Right. Path. Okay. If you were to, um, in any way pursue some illegal recourse against Mr. Braniff... not only would I be obligated to take you in...

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Presuming you were to find out.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Which I probably would, because I have the radar of... a witch.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: That’s a harsh way to put it.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: It’s a phrase coined by my ex husband.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Then he was cheating on you.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (smiles) Still.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Get back to, if you had to take me in...

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Right. If you were to go to prison for some... protracted period... we would, ah... Cole is dying to know where this is going.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: We would what?

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (sighs, gives it up) ..--never, ah, have a second date. Cole beams. Did he just hear what he thought he heard? Th this intelligent and attractive woman is INTERESTED in hi

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Fuck me! This motherfucker’s Fort Knox!!!  89. Cole cringes and scuttles to the far end of the room, wav at Slide to shut up.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I would really not like anything... to get in the way of that.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (pleased) Really? Slide GETS THE SAFE OPEN. Cole doesn’t notice.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (firmly) Oh yeah. But, ah, that wasn’t much of a date, was it?

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (blushing) Well, you paid...

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I should have had that second drink.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: You think? Slide is waving at Cole. Cole doesn’t notice.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I just... I don’t know, it’s been so long since I’ve really relaxed with someone... Slide THROWS A PILLOW at Cole’s head. Cole finally sees T SAFE starting to OPEN...! COLE (CONT’D) Gotta go. Work. Work. It’s work--

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Oh. Sure. I hope-- CLICK! He’s gone. She’s left staring at the receiver, not sure what happened. Back in the Braniff apartment, Cole and Slide are staring the safe. Their faces fall. Because the safe is dead empty.  90.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Now this is a disappointment. Cole stares in disbelief. He steps forward to feel inside the safe, for a trap door, anything. All he finds is a CD ROM lying on its floor.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, we got us some Barry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the Sentry finishes one magazine, moves onto the ne DING! Someone’s arriving via elevator. It’s Charlie. He’s elated/relieved to see the Sentry awake.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hey, how ya doin’?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT CUNNINGHAM
dialogues.text: Okay, thanks. (pointedly) How can I help you? Charlie looks to the door to the penthouse, shut. Wonders what’s going on in there?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh, I just came up to see if everything’s alright up here.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT CUNNINGHAM
dialogues.text: Because the Federal Bureau of Investigation is inept?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Well, the whole Kennedy thing was kind of a debac-- A stony stare from Cunningham.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nonono, you guys are great...just... wanted to know if you need anything--

dialogues.speaker: AGENT CUNNINGHAM
dialogues.text: --that several thousand takeout menus can’t provide? There are, indeed, 10 dead rainforests’ worth of takeout menus stacked to the ceiling. Charlie’s not getting anywhere. He keeps looking at the door: what to do?  gl. INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- CONTINUOUS Cole and Slide continue to weigh their options.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Maybe...maybe... (re: the disc) .+-mMaybe this is something, I don’t know, something that--

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: --has twenty million dollars hidden in it? Shrunk down by some ol’ “miniaturization” machine!

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: We have to at least look at this.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: (annoyed) It’s probly some DVD of some four- way with some other old, ugly-ass couple?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (tapping his forehead) I don’t need those images right now-

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Rich folks like to keep shit like that in their safe. You know, “savor the moment,” for later.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Ewwww, just -- would you STOP! With Slide, and only Slide, Cole reverts to age 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie’s still working on Cunningham.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Awful quiet in there. Maybe we should check.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT CUNNINGHAM
dialogues.text: The Towers does advertise soundproof doors. Charlie sighs.  92.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Right. INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- CONTINUOUS Cole, meanwhile, is succumbing to the reality that this w huge folly. He’s pissed at himself.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry! I’m sorry! I’m sorry I dragged you guys into this--! Meanwhile, Slide roams the apartment, looking for things steal. He eyes the wine refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Well, we gotta cut some losses. They’s some pretty fine reds in there--

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: No! No no, I’m not a common thief!

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, then, what are you? A special thief?

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: A “frisky” thief?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Just... let it go.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Is you or ain’t you a thief?!

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I’m a Robin Hood thief! I want that 20 million to give back to my staff!

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: A thief is a motherfuckin thief! So get your tidy whitey ass in gear, and take a good look around this place for something we can cash in for our valuable time--!  93. Slide stops cold. Cole follows his gaze. LOOKING THROUGH 1958 AUSTIN-HEALEY'S WINDSHIELD as our guys move into vie Slide taking it in like he’s discovering lost treasure. Which he might just be.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why’s he keep this up here?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Why do you think? A classic “tiny penis” move.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: (surveying) Nah. This is not a male enhancement vehicle. This is a showtune-singing little pussy car, if you ask m-- He stops, struck by something.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What. What.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Pull up your flashlight app. MOMENTS LATER, AT FLOOR LEVEL: The Austin-Healey’s body l up and Slide wiggles underneath it. On his back, light be blazing cell phone between his teeth. He looks up and dow the chassis, then draws up a pen knife and scratches at i metal. He blinks as black flakes fall into his eyes. Meanwhile, Cole grips the rear bumper, straining to keep two-seater lifted for Slide.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What. What. The only response is LAUGHTER, then:

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Robin. Your men gonna be merry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitz has joined Dev and they sit here, nothing to do but wait, when they hear the platform motor rev up. They rise see Cole and Slide ascend into view, empty-handed.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Change of plans.  94. MOMENTS LATER: All four men stand in silence. It’s a lot like their training scene on Cole’s roof, except they’re freezing and dumbfounded -- they’re just dumbfounded. Finally, in disbelief:

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: What kinda dude melts gold down...into a chassis of a car?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Someone who’s number's up. They all think. DEV’ REAUX Can we just break it up, take the parts that are gold?

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: No time. Whole chassis’s made of gold. Braniff’ll wake up soon.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Or Shoeless Jane’1l be back. A beat. DEV’ REAUX So that’s just it? We all just tiptoe outta here and pretend none of this happened?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (an idea) No. They all look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door bursts open and Dev and Fitz sprint into the Hanco apartment-under-renovation, deserted. As they hustle past tools, planks, and other debris --

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: ..-this is crazy, this is crazy, this is crazy...

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: ..--I know, I know, I know... Arriving at the GIANT TARPS covering the windows, they ri them down revealing a GAPING HOLE to the outside.  95. INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- CONTINUOUS A MATCHING GAPING HOLE exists now here, four flights up. full panel of window has now been cut away; the hole is large enough to, well, drive a car through. T window-washing platform has been pulled inside and rests the living room, cables still attached. Tires roll noiselessly across the hardwood floors. Slide pushes the Austin-Healey as Cole steers, leaning in throu the driver’s window. They stop a few feet short of the windowless panel. Unhooking the cables from the window-washing platform, th each lie down and attach them to the car’s undercarriage. In the back, Braniff snores away, dead to the world. Cole and Slide rise to test the cables: secure.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (into his walkie) Mr. Dev’reaux?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dev and Fitz frantically build a ramp of cinderblocks and planks and other material. Dev’reaux answers the call:

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Howard. COLE’S VOICE I need you back in position. Dev tears off, leaving Fitz on his own, calling after him

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait: I have to do this part alone?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Svichkar has overheard this, bewildered. He turns to Charlie, who senses the urgency in Cole’s voice.

dialogues.speaker: SVICHKAR
dialogues.text: “Back in position?” He was s‘posed to relieve me ten minutes ago.  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole and Slide look out the windowless panel, at the side full of people far below.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Here’s where it gets tricky.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Oh, ‘cause it was so easy before! DEV’ REAUX’S VOICE (breathless) Mr. Howard, I’m in position. Cole grabs hold of a beam and leans out the window to loo up. Above him, Dev leans over the edge. Cole signals him: take it up. UP ABOVE: Dev hits the ‘up’ button on the manual override muttering to himself in fear.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: My job’s “compartmentalized.” Right. Well, I am exceeding my job description! And I have EARNED my motherfucking bonus! IN THE PENTHOUSE: The cables grow taut and the Austin-Hea starts to roll toward the open window. As the back bumper clears the window, the cables lift the rear tires off the floor and Cole and Slide gently push the car’s front out window and -- -- it’s aloft, dangling upside down a thousand feet in th air, twisting in the breeze. ABOVE IT: Dev stops retracting the cables and, with a sig from Cole, begins to lower the car. BELOW IT: Fitzhugh, alone in the construction site, watch the automobile descend toward him.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Ah shit, it’s coming to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More ruddy faces, parade drums, bagpipes. High above, the Austin-Healey looks like a white beetle creeping along th glass seventy floors up. A few revelers notice, too drunk too immured by New York’s every day audacity to be alarme  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie’s attending to a RESIDENT when a PASSERBY shouts the lobby and points upward.

dialogues.speaker: PASSERBY
dialogues.text: Hope you gotta permit for that! Charlie’s spine stiffens: this can’t be good. He excuses himself, rounds the desk and hurries outside.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Mr. Gibbs, what'd he mean? They both push out onto the sidewalk til they come into v of the Austin-Healey high above, inching closer to the Hancock’s floor. Charlie rushes inside --

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: .--ah-no, ah-no-no-no... -- leaving Lester to peer up on his own, jaw-dropped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole and Slide monitor the car’s descent. Fitzhugh signal them: stop, and Cole signals Dev above: stop. ABOVE: Dev stops the cables. BELOW: Fitzhugh’s too cautious to just reach out and grab Austin’s grill. First, he finds some rope and ties it aro a cement mixer, then clinging to it with one hand reaches with the other -- -- and leaning half out the windowless panel he tries onc twice, three times to grasp it. Cole watches, concerned. Fitzhugh gives a little slack to his safety rope and lean out again. At last he manages to grasp the grille --

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Got it!! -- just as another sharp gust of wind banks off the Tower pushes the Austin away from its face, dragging with it -- -- Fitzhugh, who loses his grip on the rope and ends up w only a grip on the car, resulting in --  98. -- his dangling a thousand feet in the air clinging to th front of a vintage automobile made partly of gold as the Saint Patrick’s Day Parade continues below him. Crazier things have happened in New York. Cole and Slide watch helplessly. There’s no way out of the apartment. Dev watches, too, in horror. Into his mic: DEV’ REAUX Should I bring him up?! Cole signals below: NO! For fear it’ll jostle him. Fitzhugh keeps one hand clasped to the grill and tries to reach for the rope dangling out of the windowless panel w the other. He’s inches from it. Still he can’t reach it. He loses hope for a moment, then recommits himself, strai to grasp the rope -- -- when A HAND lunges out and grabs him by the arm and ya him into safety. It’s Charlie. Who glares at him, mad but relieved.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I must be out of my mind. Fitz, on the floor, can’t believe he’s alive. Cole and Slide peer down, mystified.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Where'd he go? Then Charlie appears in the frame below, glowering up at Cole. Cole can’t help but gratefully smile back. Then, Charlie does something surprising -- -- he waves for the car to be lowered even more. Cole obe the order, gestures to Dev above to continue lowering. Wh Charlie signals to stop, Cole repeats it. Inside, Fitzhugh gasps for air.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Thanks. I didn’t think you’d--

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sir, you live in The Tower. It’s a full service building. And we're pulling this baby in.  99. MOMENTS LATER, FROM ABOVE: Charlie and Fitz both reach ou and grab the Austin-Healey, a two-man job if there ever w one. Cole signals Dev to lower it and -- -- the ex-banker and concierge guide the car onto the makeshift ramp until it’s safely rolled inside. The cables go slack and Charlie signals for them to stop. With Fitzhugh’s help, he disconnects the cables. IN THE PENTHOUSE: Slide signals Dev to raise the cables a Cole moves the window-washer platform in position. ON THE ROOF: Dev hits ‘Up’ but nothing happens. He tries again. Zilch. He shouts down:

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: It won’t come up! IN THE PENTHOUSE: Slide looks to Cole: you hear that? Col peers up at Dev:

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: The motor’s cooked! Cole and Slide realize: they’re not taking the platform o here. A moment of reckoning. Arthur Braniff starts moaning and stirring. Waking up.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: How do you see it?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: We leave by the door, we go to prison.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Or--? MOMENTS LATER, they step out onto the edge of the penthou windowless panel, cables wrapped around their waists, and -- begin rappelling down the side of the building, gloved hand over gloved hand. Cole looks down, sees Charlie and Fitzhugh waiting below, the sidewalk sixty-six stories beneath them. Jee-zus. ON SIXTY-SIX: Dev arrives beside Charlie and Fitzhugh. Th all watch Cole and Slide descend.  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More and more people are starting to pay attention to the stunt high, high above them. Among them: some COPS. They start moving toward the Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester continues peering up. It’s begun to dawn on him ju who might be risking life and limb up there. And possibly even why. He spies the cops rounding the corner, heading way, and he wanders back inside -- -- locking the front door behind him. INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- CONTINUOUS Braniff’s eyes open. He squints around the room: how the hell did I get on the floor? He moans, then struggles to up. And feels something odd: a breeze.

dialogues.speaker: BRANIFF
dialogues.text: Susan? He staggers to his feet. Moves into the next room. And discovers an absence. At first, he doubletakes. Can’t believe it. But as he slowly realizes, yes, it’s true-- His Austin-Healey is missing!! He begins to hyperventilate. Then, sobs like a girl. OUTSIDE: Cole and Slide continue their shimmy down. Slide arrives first and Fitzhugh grabs him and pulls him in. IN THE PENTHOUSE: Braniff rushes into his living room. Se the window-washing platform. Then the missing panel of gl in his window. The cables coming from the roof. Goes to them. FROM BELOW: He peers down from his window. And sees -- -- one man scaling down one of the cables and another man pulling him into safety.

dialogues.speaker: BRANIFF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Cole and Charlie both look up. And lock eyes with Braniff It’s hey-ho, let’s go all over again.  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole detaches his cable.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Braniff saw us!

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: He saw us both.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: What do we do? Eyes are on Cole. Who looks to Charlie. Who nods: he’s in

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What would Houdini do?! He’d make this damn thing disappear! INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- CONTINUOUS Braniff makes a beeline for a phone. He picks it up, call downstairs. Nothing. Fuck. He moves directly for his front door and thrusts his foot across the threshold. A red light FLASHES on his ankle bracelet. Beep-beep-beep!

dialogues.speaker: BRANIFF
dialogues.text: They s-stole my car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Denham’s in a budget meeting which has nearly put h to sleep when a JUNIOR AGENT barges in.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR AGENT
dialogues.text: Arthur Braniff just set off his -- Jillian’s out of her seat before he finishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CABAL OF POLICEMEN are pounding on the door and yelling Inside, Lester appears, playing up his old age; he puts a hand to ear -- whatyawant? -- then starts fumbling in his pockets, stalling for time: where did I put that key now.  102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elevator doors open and Dev gets in. He hits a button, th ‘Close Doors’ urgently. He counts to two-thousand in his head, then pulls the Emergency Break. Back on 66, Cole, Slide, Charlie and Fitzhugh push the Au over the rubble of the construction site to the elevator. Slide grabs a crowbar and pries its doors open. In the shaft, the roof of Dev’s elevator has stopped two feet beneath their floor level.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Sideways. The four men tip the automobile on its side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester finally gets the door open. The Cops rush in.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Slow down, slow down: gosh, what’s all this fuss about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men have the Austin on its side --

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: One-two-three, go. -- then push it into the elevator shaft so that its grill dips down atop the elevator car below. Like the flag-rais on Iwo Jima, they arc the Austin-Healey up and into the s entirely. Everyone’s a little stunned it fit.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (to Slide and Fitz) You and you, with me on top. (to Charlie) Take the freight to the basement. Look for a place to hide this.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: And then?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I’ve got the ride down to figure that out.  103. Slide and Fitz step onto the elevator roof. Meanwhile, Co gives a last instruction to Charlie, unheard. Charlie tak off and Cole joins them inside the shaft. They all take h of the car, to keep it steady. Cole smiles at Dev’reaux. COLE (CONT’D) How’re you liking the job so far? (then, downward) Mr. Dev’reaux, basement please. IN THE ELEVATOR CAR: Dev hits the button and they descend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NYPD COPS have entered to inquire about ‘just-what-the-fu is going on upstairs. Svichkar is trying to understand wh they’re complaining about when -- -- Jillian marches in, leading a phalanx of other FBI Age She goes straight to the elevators and Mr. Washington.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Where’s the elevator to the penthouse? (Washington indicates its floor on a panel) Get it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dev sees ‘Lobby’ illuminate on his panel. He shouts up:

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: Guys! Someone’s calling for the elevator from the lobby! Cole, Slide and Fitz watch shaft walls zip up around them

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Can’t he override it?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Not from the lobby! Something catches Fitzhugh’s eyes. The portion of the chassis Slide scraped clean. It shines beautifully.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Holy God, it is made of gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jillian waits impatiently. The elevator arrives at last a its doors open to reveal Dev, trying to look nonchalant.  104.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: Miss Denham. Hello. (she steps aboard with a quartet of agents) Floor, please.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Cut the shit. He hits ‘PH.’ Above them, Cole, Slide and Fitzhugh trade worried looks the elevator starts to ascend again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie exits the freight elevator and nearly bulldozes CUSTODIANS on his way to the resident elevators.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Pardon. He spies the floor numbers increasing on Dev’s elevator.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dev tries to make small talk.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: So, you going up to see Mr. Braniff? She ignores him. That’s okay. Dev’s accomplished what he intended. Because -- -- above, Cole has heard who’s inside/where they’re going Beside him, Slide stares straight up and whispers:

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: Think there’1l be enough room? It’s a good question. He, Cole and Fitz can always duck. That’s not true of the Austin-Healey between them. They all prepare to crouch as the elevator slows. It’s go to be tight. They brace for impact, and -- -- the rear bumper of the Healey crunches up against the ceiling just as the elevator stops --  105. -- causing, INSIDE THE ELEVATOR, its roof to flex downwar It goes unnoticed by anyone but Dev, who inches into a co of the elevator in case the Healey comes crashing through

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: (as doors open) Penthouse! INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- CONTINUOUS Jillian exits the elevator and comes quickly into contact with Arthur Braniff and Agent Cunningham.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Braniff. Are you aware--

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR BRANIFF
dialogues.text: My phone’s dead -- I wanted you here! Look! Howard and Gibbs broke in here and stole my car! I saw them! LOOKLOOKLOOK!!! Jillian wrinkles an eyebrow: did she hear that right? Braniff thrusts a finger toward the void in his apartment formerly filled by an automobile. She takes it in.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: No question: your car is gone.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR BRANIFF
dialogues.text: You see?! You see?!

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Your car must be very important to you...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR BRANIFF
dialogues.text: Oh, for God's sake, there are only 56 left in the WORLD--!

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: ..-because you just forfeited ten million dollars. This lands with a thud.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR BRANIFF
dialogues.text: No! I didn’t! I wasn’t escaping! I wanted someone up here--! It is slowly dawning on him that he has made a mistake. S gives him a stony stare. He brazens it out.  106. ARTHUR BRANIFF (CONT’D) Now look, I’ve had about enough of this shit! More stony stare. Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As its doors close, Dev lets out a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: Back to the basement? Above, Cole thinks in silence. Fitz and Slide trade a loo

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: No. Braniff‘1ll tell her it was us, she'll have agents scouring the whole place.

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Then where do we take this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet hallway. Then: elevator doors are pried open and two-seater sportscar is lowered onto it carpeting. Slide, Fitzhugh and Cole push the car clear from the elevator sh

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You guys got it? They nod. He tears away to the emergency stairwell. At his front door, Fitzhugh fumbles for his keys, finds t right one at last and inserts it -- under Slide’s witheri stare. Just as he gets it open --

dialogues.speaker: OLD MRS. HOLLINGSWORTH,
dialogues.text: His neighbor, the one we previously saw in a wheelchair emerges from her apartment door. They’re caught red-hande

dialogues.speaker: FITZHUGH
dialogues.text: Uhhh.... She looks at them. She seems entirely different. Her eyes are clear, she’s spry, and she’s walking -- we realize th is the first time we’ve seen her undrugged.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: Hello, Ma’am!  107. There’s nothing good to say, so he babbles ridiculously: DEV’REAUX (CONT’D) It’s nice to see you up and about.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MRS. HOLLINGSWORTH
dialogues.text: I’m extremely unhappy with this!

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: We... don’t have much of an excuse, ma’am. The old lady barely glances at the guys, the car, the gui and fear on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MRS. HOLLINGSWORTH
dialogues.text: Well, how in the world were you to know that my daughter was deliberately keeping me insensible! (shaking her head) What money does to people...! The men stand there, holding a stolen car.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: We couldn’t agree more, ma’am. She finally seems to focus on them -- a bit.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MRS. HOLLINGSWORTH
dialogues.text: (beat, with total hauteur) But I must say, this is very shoddy. You gentlemen should be using the service elevator. She gets into the next elevator, muttering to herself. Be mega-rich and still a bit addled, she is too self-preoccu to give a damn what these common men are doing. OLD MRS. HOLLINGSWORTH (CONT’D) .--plummeting standards of service... going to make a complaint... The doors close behind her. They all look at each other: what the hell just happened. But no time to ponder. Fitz and Slide push the Austin the rest of the way into INT. THE TOWER -- FITZHUGH’S APARTMENT -- CONTINUOUS -- shutting the door behind them and collapsing against i They look at each other and smile. Holy shit, they did it  108. INT. THE TOWER -- BRANIFF’S PENTHOUSE -- DAY Agents fan out as Braniff backpedals a mile a minute to Jillian.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR BRANIFF
dialogues.text: Oh, now, look, I have already cut the deal, there’s nothing to talk about! You take me in, you’1ll get called out on the carpet! Agent Farley enters from another room, approaches Jillian

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FARLEY
dialogues.text: You've gotta see this... Jillian follows him. So does Braniff. They come into view of the large hole in the wall Slide made and the empty sa within it. Braniff hadn’t spotted this before and he blanches. Meanwhile, Jillian realizes: this is the safe C was telling her about. She tries not to smile.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Braniff, there seems to be a hidden safe in your apartment. During our inventory of your possessions you neglected to mention this.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR BRANIFF
dialogues.text: I, uh, I...

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: You've now violated two conditions of your bail. I’m sorry to say that Le Bernadin will not be delivering to your next address. I hereby remand you to federal custody. Agent Farley steps up and cuffs Braniff, who realizes pro will get him nowhere. Farley and Cunningham lead him out. Jillian considers the empty safe again, then goes to the absent window and looks out at the lines of cable twistin downward. She can’t quite believe Cole did this.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to a Junior Agent) Do a sweep of the entire building. Especially that floor with all the construction.  109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie enters, sees cops in the lobby, not sure if he’s being hunted, off-the-hook or what. He passes by Ms. Pere

dialogues.speaker: PEREZ
dialogues.text: Where the hell you been? You missed all the excitement? Charlie pulls Perez aside.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Miss Perez, can I trust you with something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Svichkar’s on duty at the desk, Washington’s standing in lobby attendant, and Lester’s shooing away lookieloos out front. Charlie taps Svichkar’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Go on your break. I got it. Charlie tries to resume his work and not look guilty as h as cops and FBI agents scurry back and forth. He feels a presence creep up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’re both screwed, you know that. It’s Cole, out of his window-washer’s jumpsuit and back i his manager’s threads at last.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I know. It’s been a pleasure, though. --Well, not most of it. From the elevators, Braniff is led out. As he passes thro the lobby, he stares daggers at Cole. But he says nothing Next: Braniff passes Lester on the way out. lLester’s han find their way into his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: You can open the door yourself, Mr. Braniff. Exit Arthur Braniff.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: At least he’s going away for good.  110.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Not from us. We’ll get the cell next door. Cole winces.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You do that thing I asked? Charlie nods. Now, from the elevators, comes Jillian. Col puts on a hopeful smile for her but it fades as she approaches. Because she looks deadly serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN SLOW-MO: A DRUMS-AND-BAGPIPES VERSION OF “MINSTREL BOY

dialogues.speaker: CLASPED HANDS TO DISGUISE THE HANDCUFFS ON THEIR WRISTS.
dialogues.text: THERE’S MORE DIGNITY THAN SHAME IN THIS PERP WALK, LIKE SOLDIERS BEING LED TO AN ENEMY’S FIRING SQUAD.

dialogues.speaker: A VOICE
dialogues.text: This is FBI Regional Director Mazin interrogating suspects Cole Howard and Charles Gibbs in the robbery of the penthouse apartment of Arthur Braniff. March seventeenth, three- thirty-four a.m..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIRECTOR MAZIN and Jillian sit across from Cole and Charl

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MAZIN
dialogues.text: Mr. Howard, Mr. Gibbs, as you’re aware, Arthur Braniff identified both of you as perpetrators in the theft of his antique, sorry what was it --  111.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: -- 1958 Austin-Healy --

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MAZIN
dialogues.text: -- thank you, the theft of his antique 1958 Austin-Healey yesterday from his seventieth floor penthouse apartment in the Tower building. (he shakes his head, not quite believing it) Guys, I guess the principal question I want to ask you is: why the hell did you do this? Cole and Charlie share a look: you wanna tell him?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: As I did not do it, I can’t answer. I guess, though, I can speculate. I can tell you why I would do it if given the opportunity, which of course I have not had. He lets this wash over the room for a moment, then contin

dialogues.speaker: COLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I personally would not want to witness the faces of my staff when they open their envelopes and find zeros where their life savings used to be. I know that I would do my damndest to change the look on their faces when those envelopes are opened, to one of relief and joy. I can honestly say that I would do just about anything on this earth to bring that about... IF I had the ingenuity... They are hanging on his words.

dialogues.speaker: COLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .--which, unfortunately, being a glorified servant, I really don’t. He smiles benignly -- the ultimate passive/aggressive cou Admitting nothing, admitting everything.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MAZIN
dialogues.text: That is tantamount to an admission, sir, and don’t think--  112.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR AGENT
dialogues.text: Their lawyer is here.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MAZIN
dialogues.text: (to Cole and Charlie) You guys call somebody? (Cole and Charlie shake their heads) Send him in. Ms. Perez enters, still in her Tower uniform, a legal val in hand. She carries herself like an experienced lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: MS. PEREZ
dialogues.text: Good morning. My name is Elizabeth Perez, I'll be representing these gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MAZIN
dialogues.text: (eyeing her uniform) Ms. Perez, are you licensed to practice law in New York State?

dialogues.speaker: MS. PEREZ
dialogues.text: As of noon yesterday, yessir, I am.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MAZIN
dialogues.text: Have a seat then. You know the charges being brought against your clients?

dialogues.speaker: MS. PEREZ
dialogues.text: I do. And I’m going to ask that they be immediately dropped.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MAZIN
dialogues.text: On what grounds? She opens her valise and withdraws the CD-ROM from Branif safe (which Charlie gave her earlier). DIRECTOR MAZIN (CONT’D) What is that? Jillian has a pretty good idea; she won’t meet Cole’s eye But she’s smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole and Charlie bid Ms. Perez adieu.  113.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Not twenty-four hours a lawyer and you’re already blackmailing the Feds.

dialogues.speaker: PEREZ
dialogues.text: (grins) Sharks are born swimming.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What just happened in there?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Those were Braniff’s files on the disc. (as Perez nods) You look at ‘em? (she nods) Make a copy? (she shrugs: maybe) Good girl. You may take the rest of the day off.

dialogues.speaker: MS. PEREZ
dialogues.text: Thank you, gentlemen. She means for their actions yesterday. She shakes both th hands and goes. Cole and Charlie consider each other, gul between them long gone. They start walking. Jillian, in a window above, watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we first saw it. City waking up. Workers hustling to g to their a.m. shifts. Among them now are Cole and Charlie, crossing town togeth in yesterday’s clothes, two old friends walking in silenc They round a corner and head toward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still and beautiful and idle at this hour. Cole and Charl have shifts to start, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole and Charlie enter. Lester says nothing -- he drops a professionalism and hugs them. As they cross the lobby they are aware of a SLOW BUILDING APPLAUSE from the porters, janitors, Mr Svichkar -- every  114. They pass the elevators.

dialogues.speaker: DEV ' REAUX
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. Howard. Good morning, Mr. Gibbs. Cole grabs him by the neck and hugs him. Charlie tussles hair. Cole turns back to his staff, moved beyond words. H looks around at the applauding lobby, tries to think of something to say... He never gets the chance. MR. SIMON looms before them, furious.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SIMON
